items.title: Mission
items.subtitle: Our Mission
items.content: To safeguard personal data, uphold individuals' privacy rights, and promote a responsible data culture across public and private sectors.

items.title: Vision
items.subtitle: Our Vision
items.content: To be a trusted and effective privacy regulator that strengthens digital confidence, ensures compliance, and supports Somalia’s digital development.

items.title: Values
items.subtitle: Our Core Values
content: Integrity: We act honestly and ethically in all our work.
Transparency: We promote openness in decisions and communication.
Accountability: We uphold our responsibilities and expect others to do the same.
Innovation: We embrace digital advancement and efficient service delivery.
Public Trust: We serve with dedication to protect citizen rights.

description: The Somalia Data Protection Authority (DPA) is the independent guardian of Somalis’ privacy, tasked with enforcing the 2023 Data Protection Act. It guides public and private organizations to handle personal data responsibly through awareness campaigns, registrations, trainings, and bespoke regulations. By empowering individuals with clear rights and control, DPA ensures transparency, trust, and security across the nation.
